articles.title: Mapping Burns and Natural Reforestation using Thematic Mapper Data
articles.authors: Lopez Garcia, M., and V. Caselles
articles.your_summary: They were looking for what thermal bands from Landsat were the best for mapping forest fires. They made a vegetation and temperature index of all of the burn areas. They decided using the bands 4 and 7 were best. They concluded the formula 4-7/4+7 was the best way to map forest fires.

articles.title: Landscape Assessment: Remote Sensing of Severity, the Normalized Burn Ratio; and Ground Measure of Severity, the Composite Burn Index.
articles.authors: Key, C. and N. Benson, N
articles.your_summary: The authors monitored fires wildfires around Glacier National Park in 1994. They discovered a way to monitor large and inaccessible fires through remote sensing. This could also be used on small fires, though not cost-effective. They concluded, same as the other authors, that the Normalized Burn ratio formula was best for monitoring fires.
